content_type.help.en: Type of the file content in terms of how it can be read (text, binary, etc.)

context.help.en: The context the file should be understood within (e.g. raw measurement data)

originates_from.help.en: What is the source of the file

size.help.en: Size of the file in bytes

recommended_software.help.en: The name of the software recommended for opening and working with the file

name.help.en: Short descriptive name of the processing step

description.help.en: Description of what the processing step was

software_version.help.en: The version of the software that was used for the step

link_to_source_code.help.en: If processing was performed with software where the source code is freely available a link can be specified here (e.g. self-written python script in a GitHub repository

processing_steps.help.en: List of the processing steps performed on the file before it was deposited (e.g. exported to xlsx)

general_parameters.help.en: The general information of the measurements

journal.help.en: The full name of the journal the article appears in

pid.help.en: Persistent identifier associated with the publication (e.g. DOI, ISBN, URN)

checked.help.en: Whether or not the homogeneity was checked
Whether or not the homogeneity was checked

homogeneity.help.en: Information about if, and how homogeneity was assessed

checked.help.en: Whether or not the homogeneity was checked

expected_number_of_species.help.en: The number of species that were expected to be present

method.help.en: The method used to evaluate the homogeneity

number_of_species_observed.help.en: The number of species that was observed to be present

identity.help.en: Information about if, and how identity was assessed

by_fingerprinting.help.en: How identity was determined by fingerprinting, if applicable

method.help.en: The method used for fingerprinting

by_intact_mass.help.en: How identity was determined by intact mass, if applicable

deviation_from_expected_mass.help.en: The amount, including unit, the obtained intact mass deviated from the expected intact mass

unit.help.en: The unit of the molecular weight

value.help.en: The numerical value of the molecular weight, -1 if unknown

method.help.en: The method used to determine the intact mass

by_sequencing.help.en: How identity was determined by sequencing, if applicable

coverage.help.en: The amount of the total (expected) sequence that was actually observed by sequencing in percent

method.help.en: The method that was used for sequencing

checked.help.en: Wether the identity was confirmed experimentally

method.help.en: The method that was used to determine the purity

checked.help.en: Wether or not the purity was checked
Wether or not the purity was checked

purity.help.en: Information about if, and how purity was assessed

checked.help.en: Wether or not the purity was checked

method.help.en: The method that was used to determine the purity

sequence.help.en: Primary sequence of the polymer, using single letter codes (e.g. SAGRELLE, AGTTA). In case of non-natural amino acids or nucleotides, please place the monomer in brackets

source_organism.help.en: The biological species where the polymer naturally occurs. Note that this is based on the NCBI taxonomy

type.help.en: The type of component, options are (biological) Polymer and Chemical

variant.help.en: Descriptive name indicating differences of primary sequence of the polymer as compared to the most common form, or wildtype, including mutations, purification tags, etc. (A53T, C-terminal GFP, N-terminal 6xHis-tag)

basic_information.help.en: The basic information about the chemical. This information is pulled from Pubchem, however if the information is not available it can be manually filled

derived_from.help.en: The biological substance the complex substance is derived from

fluid.help.en: The body fluid the complex substance is derived from

health_status.help.en: Health status of the donor organism where the cell fraction was derived from (e.g. healthy, sick, patient with Diabetes type 2)

preparation_protocol.help.en: List of the steps performed during the preparation of the complex substance

storage.help.en: Information about how the complex substance was stored between being acquired and measured, including temperature and duration

duration.help.en: Length of time the sample was stored before being measured

unit.help.en: The unit of the time duration

value.help.en: The numerical value of the time point or duration

storage_preparation.help.en: The specific steps that were taken to prepare the samples for storage (e.g. flash freezing in liquid nitrogen), if applicable

temperature.help.en: The temperature the sample was stored at

unit.help.en: The unit of temperature

value.help.en: The numeric value of the temperature

cell_type.help.en: The cell type the cell fraction was derived from

organ.help.en: The organ the cell fraction was derived from (e.g. heart)

tissue.help.en: The tissue type the cell fraction was derived from

genetic_material.help.en: The genetic material carried by the virions (None, virus genome, synthetic)

host_cell_type.help.en: The host cell type the virion was produced in

host_organism.help.en: The host organism the virion was produced in. Note that information is based on the NCBI taxonomy

location.help.en: The coordinates, in decimal notation, where the complex substance was collected

latitude.help.en: The latitude, from south to north, in degrees (decimal notation)

longitude.help.en: The longitude, from west to east, in degrees (decimal notation)

source.help.en: The environmental source where the complex substance was derived from

class.help.en: The chemical origin where the complex substance was derived from

number_of_mono_layers.help.en: The number of lipid mono layers in the lipid assembly, -1 if unknown

size.help.en: The size of the lipid assembly

lower.help.en: The lower bound of the size

type.help.en: The type of size (e.g. radius)

unit.help.en: The unit of the size

upper.help.en: The upper bound of the size

product.help.en: The type of product, byproduct, or waste product the complex substance was derived from

funding_references.help.en: List of information about the grants that supported generation of the raw data annotated by this record. Note that this information is based on OpenAire Projects

instrument.help.en: Information about the instrument being used to collect (measure) the raw data annotated by this record

raw_measurement_files.help.en: List of file(s) containing the raw measurements

record_information.help.en: Information about the record itself, including whether this particular record is associated with other records

access_rights.help.en: The access rights to the uploaded files. There are three options, 1) "open access" where the files are accessible immediately when the deposition is published, 2) "embargoed access" where the files will only become available after a specified date, 3) "restricted access" where depositors are of the record are the only ones who has access

date_available.help.en: The date when the data was/will be made publicly available. Will be automatically generated

deposition_date.help.en: The date when the data was deposited; automatically generated

external_identifier.help.en: The external identifier of the record which is a DOI generated by Datacite. This will automatically be generated when the record is published

metadata_access_rights.help.en: The access rights to the metadata. Minimal metadata that includes title and depositors is accessible regardless of which type is chosen as it is required to obtain a DOI. There are three options, 1) "open access" where the complete metadata are accessible immediately when the deposition is published, 2) "embargoed access" where the files will only become available after a specified date, 3) "restricted access" where depositors are of the record are the only ones who has access

publisher.help.en: When made available MBDB is to be considered the publisher, however, the depositors are still the owners

resource_type.help.en: DataCite item which shows type of dataset the record is and corresponds directly to which kind of technique was used (MST/BLI/SPR)

resource_type_general.help.en: All records are considered to be datasets

subject_category.help.en: DataCite subject category the record data belongs to default is Biophysics

title.help.en: Short descriptive title of the record

results.help.en: List of the results (parameter) that were derived by analyzing the raw data, and which steps were taken to obtain them

unit.help.en: Unit of the concentration

name.help.en: Descriptive name (id) of the result (e.g. Kd of Lysozyme and VHH2). Must be unique within a record

enum: Change in Gibbs free energy deltaG
type.help.en: The type of physical parameter the result represents

entity.help.en: Name (ids) of the entity (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters)

copy_number.help.en: Number of copies of the entity that contribute to the result, -1 if unknown (e.g. if two individual copies of a polymer binds to another, the copy number would be 2)

entities_involved.help.en: List of chemical or molecular assemblies the result describes and how many copies of each are involved

value.help.en: Numerical value of the result

lower.help.en: The lower error, i.e. the number that should be subtracted from the value to get the lower bound of the 95 % confidence interval. The same unit as the value being described is assumed. If relative errors are provided, please provide it in fractional form (e.g.  0.01 for 1 %)

upper.help.en: The upper error, i.e. the number that should be added to the value to get the upper bound of the 95 % confidence interval. The same unit as the value being described is assumed. If relative errors are provided, please provide it in fractional form (e.g.  0.01 for 1 %)

is_relative.help.en: True if the error values should be interpreted as relative errors (fractional uncertainty)

value_error.help.en: The expected error of the result in terms of a 95 % confidence interval

time_length.help.en: The numerical value of the total time of the measurement step took in the units defined in the general parameters

value.help.en: The numerical value of the time point or duration

value.help.en: The numerical value of the concentration, -1 if unknown

entity.help.en: Name (id) of the entity (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters)

name.help.en: Short descriptive name (id) of the entity; must be unique within a record (e.g. Lysozyme, Serum from Patient 1). This name is referenced in the measurement description to identify the entities present in measured sample

chemical_environment.help.en: Name (id) of the chemical environment of the sample (from the chemical environments defined in the general parameters)

id.help.en: Unique ID for the chemical environment to be used as a link

name.help.en: Name of the chemical environment (e.g. Measurement Buffer). The name must be unique within a record as it will be referred to the in method specific section in when describing the composition of the individual samples or measurement steps

plate.help.en: link to one of the plates

id.help.en: id to be used for internal links

name.help.en: Name (id) of the plate which must be unique within a record

preparation_protocol.help.en: List of steps taken to prepare the sample

temperature.help.en: Temperature of the sample while being measured

unit.help.en: The unit of temperature

value.help.en: The numeric value of the temperature

well_position.help.en: The position the well (in the plate) where the sample was during the measurement

sensor.help.en: link to the sensor used for the measurement

id.help.en: id to be used for internal links

plates.help.en: List of the plate types used for the measurements

id.help.en: id to be used for internal links

name.help.en: Name (id) of the plate which must be unique within a record

sealing.help.en: The type of sealing used to seal the top of the plate

supplier.help.en: Information about the supplier of the plate

catalog_number.help.en: The catalog number or identifier of the item

surface_modification.help.en: If the plate had a modified surface, the modification can specified here (e.g. Non-binding surface)

protocol.help.en: List of protocol steps used to modify the surface of the wells

type.help.en: The expected type of surface of the wells after the modification (e.g. BSA coated)
The type of the plate (e.g. half-area black polystyrene)

wells.help.en: Number of wells in the plate

schema_version.help.en: The schema version used to annotate the BLI method specific parameters

sensors.help.en: List of the senors used for the measurements, reference sensors included

hydration_time.help.en: How long the sensor was hydrated before being employed

unit.help.en: The unit of the time duration

value.help.en: The numerical value of the time point or duration

id.help.en: id to be used for internal links

ligand_information.help.en: Information about the ligand and how it was immobilized

ligand.help.en: Name (id) of the ligand (entity that is immobilized, from the list of entities of interest defined in the general parameters)

name.help.en: Short descriptive name (id) of the entity; must be unique within a record (e.g. Lysozyme, Serum from Patient 1). This name is referenced in the measurement description to identify the entities present in measured sample

ligand_immobilization_chemistry.help.en: The type of chemistry on ligands and surface that allows for immobilization of the ligands on the surface of the senor

ligand_immobilization_protocol.help.en: List of steps for immobilizing the ligand on the surface of the sensor

previously_used.help.en: Whether or not the sensor was used for previous measurements

sensor_id.help.en: The id of the sensor as given by the supplier

supplier.help.en: Information about the supplier of the senor

catalog_number.help.en: The catalog number or identifier of the item

surface_properties.help.en: The type of surface properties the sensor has, e.g. Protein A
